title.value: DiffPack: A Torsional Diffusion Model for Autoregressive Protein Side-Chain Packing
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper as stated in the document.
title.quote: DiffPack: A Torsional Diffusion Model for Autoregressive Protein Side-Chain Packing

extractions.description: The paper introduces DiffPack, a torsional diffusion model for predicting protein side-chain conformations by autoregressively generating torsional angles and training separate diffusion models for each angle. The method demonstrates improved accuracy on benchmarks like CASP13 and CASP14 compared to existing methods, including enhancements to AlphaFold2 predictions.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical evaluation on benchmarks for protein side-chain packing demonstrating performance improvements.
type.quote: We evaluate the method on several benchmarks for protein side-chain packing and show that our method achieves improvements...

name.justification: The research focuses on predicting protein side-chain conformations, a central task in computational biology.
name.quote: Accurately predicting the conformation of protein side-chains given their backbones is important for applications in protein structure prediction...

name.justification: The specific focus is on predicting the conformations of protein side-chains, which is a sub-field of protein structure prediction.
name.quote: In this work, we focus on the problem of predicting side-chain conformation with fixed backbone structure, a.k.a., protein side-chain packing.

name.justification: The paper introduces DiffPack as the main contribution for predicting protein side-chain packing.
name.quote: In this work, we present DiffPack, a torsional diffusion model that learns the joint distribution of side-chain torsional angles...

name.justification: The paper uses CASP13 for evaluating the performance of the DiffPack model.
name.quote: ...achieves improvements of 11.9% and 13.5% in angle accuracy on CASP13 and CASP14...

name.justification: The paper uses CASP14 along with CASP13 for performance evaluation.
name.quote: ...achieves improvements of 11.9% and 13.5% in angle accuracy on CASP13 and CASP14...

name.justification: This dataset is used for training and validation of the DiffPack model.
name.quote: We use BC40 for training and validation...

name.justification: The paper utilizes GearNet-Edge for encoding protein structures as part of the DiffPack model.
name.quote: we employ GearNet-Edge [75], a state-of-the-art protein structure encoder.
